key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to reliance on natural ingredients and exposure to climate change, geopolitical tensions, and pandemics
Regulatory and compliance risks in a highly regulated industry
Intense competition from global players like Firmenich, IFF, and Symrise
Operational safety concerns highlighted by recent incidents such as the factory explosion in Louisville, Kentucky
controversies: Sustainability criticism regarding transparency and pace of initiatives
Operational safety incidents, including the deadly factory explosion in Louisville, Kentucky
environmental_issues: Climate change impacts on supply chain and sourcing practices
Need to achieve ambitious sustainability goals such as 100% renewable electricity and carbon-neutral operations by 2025
social_issues: Operational safety concerns affecting employee well-being
Stakeholder concerns over sustainability initiatives and supply chain transparency
governance_issues: Regulatory compliance risks and potential legal and reputational damage from non-compliance
Governance challenges in managing supply chain emissions and sourcing practices

sources.title: Givaudan recognised as world leader for supplier engagement on climate ...
sources.snippet: Givaudan has earned a position on the Supplier Engagement leader board by CDP, the non-profit global environmental disclosure platform, in recognition of its actions and strategies to reduce emissions and lower climate-related risk across its supply chain. Only 3% of the 5,000 companies that participated in CDP's supply chain programme in 2018 were included on the list.
